explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 4 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: :450mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001; PATTY 4th, 1994) and 510mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Rat LD50 value = 1000mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994), and rabbit LD50 value = 1500mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994). The lower value was adopted and it was set as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on rat LC50 (8 hours) value: 68ppm (4-hour equivalent: 0.51mg/L) (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994), 0.51mg/L could be judged from vapor pressure as the steam with almost no mist. And it was classified by the ppm concentration standard. 0.51mg/L was converted to 96ppm with the conversion factor (1ppm = 5.32mg/m3), and it was classified as Category 1.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on rate LC50 (4 hours) value: 200ppm (equivalent 1.06mg/L) (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994), it was set as Category 4.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from descriptions that severe irritation which produced erythema, edema and eschar was acknowledged in the test using the rabbit (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), and that severe irritation and chemical burn were acknowledged when single time application was done in the rabbit skin (PATTY (4th, 1994)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2A based on the descriptions that severe irritational property was acknowledged in the tests applied to the eyes of the animals (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: There were descriptions that strong skin sensitization was acknowledged in the test using the guinea pigs in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994), however, the test method was not clear, therefore we presupposed it not to be able to be classified for the insufficiency of data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Although the effect on the testes was observed in the repetitive inhalation exposure test using rat (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), and the 24-hour inhalation exposure test using a rabbit, there is no data of the examination which examined fertility, and it cannot be classified since data is insufficient.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (testes, respiratory organs, liver, kidneys, adrenal)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (testes, respiratory organs, liver, kidneys, adrenal)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: From description in PATTY (4th, 1994) that in the inhalation exposure test using rats, breathing difficulty, change in liver, kidney, and the adrenal gland were seen at the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 1, and description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) that testicular atrophy was seen at the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 1 in the inhalation exposure test using the rabbits. So it was set as Category 1 (testes, respiratory tracts, liver, kidney, adrenal gland) .

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (testes, blood); Category 2 (eye, immune system, kidneys, adrenal)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (testes, blood) through prolonged or repeated exposure; May cause damage to organs (eye, immune system, kidneys, adrenal) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that the effects on the testes and on the blood was observed with the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 1in the inhalation exposure test using the rat (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994)), and on the description that in the dermal administration test using the rat, the corneal opacity, and the effects on thymic, lymphs, kidney , testes, and the adrenal with the dose of the guidance value range of Category 2 (PATTY (4th, 1994)), it was classified to be Category 1 ( testes, blood) and Category 2 (eye, immune system, kidney, adrenal gland).
